result.execSummary:
The defendant Tommie R. Rothenberger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Escape-Criminal Arrest, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.42(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Fulltime employment, schooling, or combination of the two of at least 30 hours per week and if not, then perform 10 hours community service per week.
No contact with any individual under the age of 18 unless supervised by someone over the age of 25.
Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 2:37 pm 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Deft appears in person with Atty Pauline Toulouse. 
COURT questions parties re: addition/corrections to PSI. Atty Toulouse makes statement re: PSI - requests parts be stricken from PSI. 
COURT does NOT strike portions of PSI at this time. 
J.S. makes statement. 
P.L. makes statement. 
State notes its letter re: COMPAS portion of PSI. COURT notes it will not be using any opinions from PSI that are based upon the COMPAS tool. 
Argument. 
Deft makes statement. 
COURT makes findings. 
COURT ORDERS: 6 years prison system - 3 years IC and 3 years ES - CONDTIONS of ES: assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; no contact with any individual under the age of 18 unless supervised by someone over the age of 25; DNA sample; full time employment/schooling/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 10 hours CS per week; CC. 
COURT finds the deft is NOT eligible for SAP or CIP. 
COURT finds deft is entitled to 34 days sentence credit. 
COURT ORDERS cash bond returned to surety. 
COURT allows parties to retain PSI and reminds them to maintain their confidentiality 
COURT remands deft into the custody of the sheriff's dept for transport to WI State Prison System. 
Adj: 4:06 pm

from ADA Puig to Judge Jacobson re:  COMPAS
-stj
Sentencing hearing at 10-09-2015 02:30 pm
Oral ruling at 08-28-2015 01:30 pm
from bond poster to Judge requesting bond money be returned at close of case (stj)
Letters of character

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 8:37 am 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Deft appears in person with Atty Pauline Toulouse. 
Parties have received copies of PSI. 
COURT notes concerns re: PSI recommendation - deft will likely not qualify for huber release under jail criteria. 
OTR: 8:39 am BOTR: 8:41 am 
Atty Toulouse states deft wishes to proceed today. 
Atty Toulouse makes statement - notes concerns about records in the PSI. 
COURT questions Atty Toulouse re: legal authority for concerns. 
Atty Toulouse is uncertain of authority on that matter. 
Atty Toulouse request to preserve issue for purpose of appeal. 
COURT notes it will not proceed in that manner and sets briefing schedule on issue raised by Atty Toulouse - Atty Toulouse to submit brief by close of business on 7/24/2015 and State to submit brief by close of business on 8/5/2015. 
COURT notes oral ruling to be set. 
Bond continues. 
Adj: 8:44 am
